title: FraNchEstYN
text: FraNchEstYN hybrid crop–disease simulation calibration framework couples process-based C# model R interface input preparation, model launching, result analysis. integrates phenology-driven crop growth, disease epidemiology, eco-physiological processes predict yield, biomass, disease impacts, modes simulation parameter calibration. Note: FraNchEstYN currently Windows-due C# computation core. Cross-platform support progress.

title: FraNchEstYN
text: 🧟 Simulates crop growth yield disease interactions 🦠 Calibrates crop /disease parameters (crop, disease, ) 🦇 Computes performance metrics (RMSE, MAE, NSE, R²) automatically 👹 Hybrid architecture: R interface + C# executable 🕸 Windows-(Mac/Linux support development)

title: FraNchEstYN
text: GitHub (Windows):

title: FraNchEstYN
text: Minimal run example:
code: library(FraNchEstYN)  res <- franchestyn(   weather_data      = weather_df,      # one site only   management_data   = mgmt_df,         # crop/variety/resistance/sowingDOY/year   reference_data    = ref_df,          # required if calibration != "none"   cropParameters    = cropParameters$Wheat,   diseaseParameters = diseaseParameters$Septoria,   calibration       = "all",           # "none", "crop", "disease", or "all"   start_end         = c(2010, 2020),   iterations        = 200 )  str(res$outputs$summary)

what: Crop parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — cropParameters
title: Crop parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — cropParameters
text: named list predefined crop parameter sets used FraNchEstYN model. top-level names correspond crop types (e.g., "Wheat", "Maize").

title: Crop parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — cropParameters
Crop parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — cropParameters
text: named list lists lists: cropParameters[[set]][[parameter]] → parameter details list.

title: Crop parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — cropParameters
text: set named list parameters. parameter entry contains: description Description parameter unit Unit measurement min Minimum allowed value max Maximum allowed value value Default value calibration Logical flag indicating parameter used calibration

title: Crop parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — cropParameters
code: data(cropParameters) names(cropParameters)             # available crop sets #> [1] "rice"  "wheat" names(cropParameters$Wheat)       # parameters in Wheat set #> NULL cropParameters$Wheat$TbaseCrop    # details for a single parameter #> NULL

what: Disease parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — diseaseParameters
title: Disease parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — diseaseParameters
text: named list predefined disease parameter sets used FraNchEstYN model. top-level names correspond diseases (e.g., "Septoria", "WheatRust").

title: Disease parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — diseaseParameters
Disease parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — diseaseParameters
text: named list lists lists: diseaseParameters[[set]][[parameter]] → parameter details list.

title: Disease parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — diseaseParameters
text: set named list parameters. parameter entry contains: description Description parameter unit Unit measurement min Minimum allowed value max Maximum allowed value value Default value calibration Logical flag indicating parameter used calibration

title: Disease parameter sets for FraNchEstYN — diseaseParameters
code: data(diseaseParameters) names(diseaseParameters)               # available disease sets #> [1] "leaf_rust" "septoria"  names(diseaseParameters$Septoria)      # parameters in Septoria set #> NULL diseaseParameters$Septoria$Tmin        # details for a single parameter #> NULL

what: Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration — franchestyn
title: Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration — franchestyn
text: Runs FraNchEstYN C# model R. function prepares inputs (weather, management, parameters, reference), writes next package executable, builds JSON config, launches EXE, streams live console output (RMSE updates overwrite one line). Users manage paths config files manually.

title: Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration — franchestyn
code: franchestyn(   weather_data,   management_data,   reference_data = NULL,   cropParameters = NULL,   diseaseParameters = NULL,   calibration = "disease",   disease = "Septoria",   start_end = c(2000, 2025),   ... )

title: Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration — franchestyn
text: weather_data data frame one site (function stops multiple sites present). Site column (case-insensitive) required. Date fields must exist via aliases (case-insensitive; spaces, underscores dashes ignored): Year: year, yr, yyyy Month: month, mo, mn Day: day, dy, dd Hour (hourly): hour, hr, hh time step auto-detected column names: hour, hours, hourly, hr, hod present (case/space/underscore-insensitive), model assumes hourly; otherwise daily. meteorological variables passed -. management_data data frame management information site. Must include columns: crop, variety, resistance, sowingDOY, year. function adds site column internally writes sowing.csv EXE. reference_data Optional data frame observed data, required calibration != "none". Column requirements (case-insensitive; spaces, underscores dashes ignored) follow C# loader: Required date & key fields Variety: one variety, cultivar, cv Year: one year, yr DOY: one doy, day_of_year, dy, d Date reconstructed .Date(paste0(year, "-01-01")) + doy. Optional measurements (read present; empty "NA" skipped) Light interception (fint): fint, f_int, lightInterception, lightint, lightinterception Grain yield: yield, grain_yield, yld, wgrn -ground biomass (AGB): agb, above_ground_biomass, biomass, abovegroundbiomass, wtop Disease severity (required calibration "disease", "disease:NAME", "") column matching disease argument, "<disease>_sev", "<disease>_severity". cropParameters nested list crop parameters (typically FraNchEstYN::cropParameters, e.g. cropParameters$Wheat). parameter list fields: description, unit, min, max, value, calibration (logical). diseaseParameters nested list disease parameters (e.g. diseaseParameters$Septoria). structure cropParameters. calibration Character; target run. One : "none", "crop", "disease", "disease:NAME", "". Matching case-insensitive; "disease:NAME" overrides disease argument NAME. disease Character; disease name simulate/calibrate (default "Septoria"). disease calibration requested, column name (_sev/_severity variants) must exist reference_data. start_end Numeric length-2 vector: start end years (default c(2000, 2025)). Must satisfy start_end[1] <= start_end[2]. ... Advanced options (shown typical users). Currently: iterations (integer; default 100). Used calibration != "none"; otherwise ignored.

title: Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration — franchestyn
text: (Invisibly) list metadata (detected timestep, mode, calibrationModel, site, paths used, output directory). Model result files produced EXE outputs/.

title: Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration — franchestyn
text: function enforces single site weather_data. Column name checks case-insensitive tolerant spaces/underscores/dashes. Input files written installed package’s inst/bin tree near FraNchEstYN.exe (weather, parameters, reference, management). JSON config generated passed EXE. Previous CSV outputs outputs folder removed running. Console output EXE streamed live; progress lines use  update place, run ends newline + summary message.

title: Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration — franchestyn
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ franchestyn(   weather_data      = weather_df,      # one site; Year/Month/Day (+ Hour if hourly)   management_data   = mgmt_df,         # crop/variety/resistance/sowingDOY/year   reference_data    = ref_df,          # required when calibrating   cropParameters    = cropParameters$Wheat,   diseaseParameters = diseaseParameters$Septoria,   calibration       = "all",   disease           = "Septoria",   start_end         = c(2010, 2020),   iterations        = 200              # via ... ) } # }
